job_title: Housing Navigator in Jersey City, NJ
pros: Extremely flexible workplace, 6 weeks PTO, great team, and investment from management in career growth if you let them know your goals.
cons: As with most non-profits, pay could be better. But they are trying!

job_title: Support Worker in Tinton Falls, NJ
pros: Great staff & regional coordinators.
cons: Underpaid & advancement opportunities were limited

review_title: Rewarding Position rewards are too numerous to mention
pros: Good benefits, excellent opportunity to learn about self and help others
cons: extensive and continuous work connect with peers self evaluate

pros: learned a lot of basic case management, you're dealing with many people a day and if you want to get into the peer services field, it is a great start. the staff is very understanding and were great to work with.
cons: Base pay was low for the work we were doing. We also needed more staff members.

pros: Lots of growing pains but overall a great nonprofit. Decent benefits and 6 week PTO.
cons: Low salary and lack of raises

pros: Supportive co workers/supervisor. Good PTO. Flexible, understanding.
cons: Be sure to take time for self care. The work can be draining. Many clients have a hard time with boundaries. No raises.

job_title: Enhanced Support Worker in Asbury Park, NJ
pros: Great Team, benefits, working hours, overtime availability, paid time off 6 weeks
cons: Mentally Draining due to working with the mentally ill

pros: Experience to understand the mental health field
cons: Lack of leadership and no respect for others. They lost their values.

pros: The agency has a long, valued reputation of serving people with serious persistent mental illness with peer supported services. That being said...
cons: They've lost their way - big time! It was a disappointment to work there. Total chaos and no supervision or real support from any level of management. Lots of management, by the way! So, be prepared to be ignored on multiple levels all the way up to the founders who are in executive management roles. No perks, no recognition of staff. You just get to hear about their glorious history - and, it gets old because they don't operate that way anymore!

job_title: Long Term Support Worker in Eatontown, NJ
pros: Helped alot of mental health consumers with support and education to improve their lives. Caring team of co workers. Enjoyed working with mental health consumers and seeing when they made progress in their lives.
cons: Trying to get consumers to work on goals and objectives that they were not interested in working on. Trying to maintain and increasing monthly billable face to face activity with consumers at a unrealistic percentage. Too much driving around and having to do conjunct notes with consumers. Not enough pay increasing over the amount of time that I worker there.

review_title: Great place to work with good benefits
pros: Fun, care about employees, good starting pay, good co workers and managers. Great benefits- paid vacation, holiday pay, 401k, profit sharing.
cons: Support work is a very difficult task with juggling many clients and trying to get paperwork and numbers in on time. Need a strong knowledge of how to research and learning about different benefits.

pros: This agency specializes in helping to integrate mental health recipients back into the community after hospitalization.   They are forward thinking and proactive in the field of psychiatric rehabilitation.
cons: This agency does not resolve conflicts amongst service recipients easily.  They often allow conflicts to continue until the parties involved resolve it themselves, and not necessarily for the good.

job_title: Support Service Worker in Eatontown, NJ
pros: CSPNJ has a wonderful mission to help the consumers become independent within the community. Great comradery among the staff members and a very good learning experience.
cons: Not much room for growth

pros:
-decent benefits, not the best, but not the worst
-wonderful outlook toward mental health community
-fun incentives for employees
-salary is better than most competing agencies in the field
cons:
-lack of communication with upper management
-each region is different, so it's hard to stay on the same page at times

pros: Helping those with mental illness can be rewarding
cons: Compensation raises are rare, but it can happen.

review_title: Very reliable place to work with people who have some type of disability
pros: Very rewarding staff base organization
cons: It's a Non-Profit Organization you may not get a raise for sometime

review_title: Decent experience to get a foot into the field
pros: benefits, team, flexibility, clients, PTO
cons: pay, unorganized management, high expectations, burnout is common

pros: Very good company if you enjoy working with Mental health consumers.
cons: I do not  have any Cons for this company.

pros: Willing to work with you and with advocacy for mental health
cons: It's hard to advance in this company

pros:
Relaxed corporate rules
Plenty of PTO
cons:
Low pay
Bias ways
Overload of work
